physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Marked rigidity in all four extremities; choreiform movements present in trunk and proximal extremities; poor upward gaze with right eye and poor lateral and upward gaze with left eye; frequent eye blinking and chin twitching; slow, quiet, dysarthric speech with difficulty in understanding; affect appeared blunted and limited; scored 10 of 30 on MMSE.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, Mr. A showed delirium, most likely due to polypharmacy. Over time, with reductions in medication, symptoms of mania and psychomotor agitation emerged along with diminished cognitive ability. After behavioral modifications in treatment, improvement in behaviors was noted, including increased compliance with protective gear and medications.
